content: Can anyone who provides training for FHIR or tutorials please update: http://wiki.hl7.org/index.php?title=FHIR_Teaching
or if you know of something
This is an odd topic for the post. Do you want HL7's offerings listed?
yes. I drew educations attention to the page
Anyone can go back and edit topics BTW -- just click the little pencil next to the topic in a post.
Added an Event in Germany in September...
thx
This is the link to Chinese translation of the FHIR Tutorials by the Core Team: http://wiki.hl7.org.cn:81/index.php/FHIR_Tutorials

This is the link to Chinese translation of the FHIR Tutorials by the Core Team members:
http://wiki.hl7.org.cn:81/index.php/FHIR_Tutorials
@Grahame Grieve I've been giving the HL7 tutorial "FHIR for Specifiers", but I'm not sure if I am allowed to publicly share the slide deck?
why would you not? The only reason I can think of is because it's an H7 tutorial, I'm not sure what the rules are there

I can't find a public download for the slide deck on the HL7 website, so I assume it's not intended for public distribution. Note that the presentation is based on the official HL7 template with HL7 branding. Just trying to avoid conflict with HL7 org. But if you can confirm it's allowed, then I'm happy to share.
it's allowed from a FHIR perspective (IP, trademarks) but I'm not sure from an HL7 perspective - you'll have to ask the education committee

It depends how you fill out your educator's form. I always fill mine out giving joint copyright, then create the slides with a CC license. (That way I don't have to worry if I want to steal my own slides to present somewhere else.)
I love a CC license and always benefit from it. Many thx to you, the Core Team members.
Good to see FHIR going to China!
This was the 4th trip!
@David Hay Good Work!
David laid lots of good groundwork before my visit. It worked well for me- he does all the work, I get all the outcomes

I've checked, my presentations also have CC copyright so I guess it's allowed to share. I'll discuss this with Mary-Ann Boyle, just to make sure I'm not stepping on any toes. Once I get confirmation, I'll put the presentation up on the wiki.
I think we all copied from LLoyds originals so inherited the CC declaration!

@Lloyd McKenzie - where are you including the joint copyright language?
some of us, at least, already have it, but it might be good to see what you've done - I would definitely like to do the same with FHIR Terminology

@Rob Hausam my HL7 tutorial slides use the following footer line:
"© 2016 HL7 ® International. Licensed under Creative Commons. HL7 & Health Level Seven are registered trademarks of Health Level Seven International. Reg. U.S. TM Office."
thanks, Michel
@Rob Hausam Actually, I think I decided that, so long as I license under cc, I don't need joint copyright. And having only HL7 made it easier to fit the statement into the slide footer :)

I think that makes sense
did you say anything in the tutorial proposal(s) or related documents, or only the cc license on the slides?
I think I checked the box for joint copyright.
